input: To bake a cake you first need to gather your ingredients Preheat the oven to desired baking temperature Grease your preferred cake pan with crisco or butter or other non-stick spray Add eggs and vegetable oil to the dry ingredients Stir or whisk until all the dry flour has been absorbed Pour the batter into the greased cake pan Place cake pan into the oven for the required time When a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, the cake is done bakingsuppose the person does not have enough grease happens, how will it affect the cooked cake will stick to the pan.

A conducting metal, like copper, is wrapped around a piece of metal An electrical source, like a battery, produces an electrical current The electrical current flows through the wire The electrical current creates a magnetic field around the wire, magnetizing the metal The magnetic field can be turned on and off by starting or stopping the electricity sourcesuppose a great amount of copper is used happens, how will it affect more current is produced.

Contact is made with a virus The virus enters the human or animal body The virus goes to the part of the body that contains its food The virus consumes part of the body or materials that the body uses The virus replicates and spreads The virus causes symptoms in the body as the immune system tries to expel the virus.suppose more natural disasters occur happens, how will it affect more virus enters the body.

Water comes into contact with something made of iron The water combines with carbon dioxide in the air to form carbonic acid As the acid is formed, the iron starts to dissolve Some of the water breaks down into hydrogen and oxygen The free oxygen and dissolved iron bond together They form iron oxide, which is rustsuppose more iron in environment happens, how will it affect MORE rust forming.

The flu virus has receptors, which are like viral Velcro, on the surface of the virus particle The receptors will lock onto a target cell using these chemical receptors on the surface, which docks onto the cell surface The receptors  then go into the cell The receptors use it like a factory The receptors take it over and make it produce thousands or in some cases millions of copies of new viruses The copies come streaming out of the cell The copies infect other cells to make more viruses, or they escape from the body and infect a new victimsuppose having a strong immune system happens, how will it affect more new viruses created.

Air is brought in through the mouth Passes through the lungs And into the bronchial tissue The carbon dioxide is removed The lungs bring the oxygen to the rest of the body.suppose more air gets to the lungs happens, how will it affect a GREATER amount of oxygen being delivered to the blood stream.

When water freezes it becomes 10% bigger, or takes up 10% more space As water expands it puts great pressure on the walls of anything containing it, including any rocks which happen to be surrounding it The force of the pressure exerted on the rock surrounding it is enough to wedge the walls of the crack farther apart, thus expanding and deepening the crack Clay expends when wet like ice does This causes rock to break apart Some plants like mosses and lichens are capable of growing without soil on bare rock When they do this their roots penetrate pores and crevices and cause rocks to split apart as the roots force their way down through the rockssuppose less water can penetrate the rocks happens, how will it affect LESS or SLOWER erosion of rocks.

To bake a cake you first need to gather your ingredients Preheat the oven to desired baking temperature Grease your preferred cake pan with crisco or butter or other non-stick spray Add eggs and vegetable oil to the dry ingredients Stir or whisk until all the dry flour has been absorbed Pour the batter into the greased cake pan Place cake pan into the oven for the required time When a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, the cake is done bakingsuppose there will be more to fill up the cake pan happens, how will it affect a BIGGER cake.
